com.qmetry.qaf.automation.ui.annotations

Annotation Type UiElement


  • @Target(value=FIELD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface UiElement
    Use to map Form Bean property with UI form fields. com.qmetry.qaf.automation.core.ui.annotations.UiElement.java
    Author:
    chirag

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String fieldLoc
      specify locator of form field.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String defaultValue 
      java.lang.String dependingValue
      Specify value of parent field which enables this field.
      java.lang.String dependsOnField
      specify filed name on which this field is depends.
      java.lang.Class<? extends QAFExtendedWebElement> elementClass
      Optional, can be used to specify custom component to interact with UI.
      UiElement.Type fieldType
      specify type of form field.
      int order
      Specify the order in which form fields should be filled in UI.
      boolean pagewait
      Deprecated.  
      boolean readonly
      specify whether this form field is read-only? Default is false.
      boolean required
      specify whether is this a required form field? Default is false.
      java.lang.String viewLoc
      mapping with data-view : if this form field value reflected in other view page then specify locator of that field
      UiElement.Type viewType
      specify type of view element.

    • Element Detail

      • fieldLoc

        public abstract java.lang.String fieldLoc
        specify locator of form field.
        Returns:

      • fieldType

        public abstract UiElement.Type fieldType
        specify type of form field. Default is UiElement.Type.textbox
        Returns:
        Default:
        com.qmetry.qaf.automation.ui.annotations.UiElement.Type.textbox

      • viewLoc

        public abstract java.lang.String viewLoc
        mapping with data-view : if this form field value reflected in other view page then specify locator of that field
        Returns:
        Default:
        ""

      • viewType

        public abstract UiElement.Type viewType
        specify type of view element. default is UiElement.Type.text
        Returns:
        Default:
        com.qmetry.qaf.automation.ui.annotations.UiElement.Type.text

      • defaultValue

        public abstract java.lang.String defaultValue
        Default:
        ""

      • dependsOnField

        public abstract java.lang.String dependsOnField
        specify filed name on which this field is depends. This is use full in case of parent-child fields where child filed enabled/appears depending on value of parent field.
        Returns:
        Default:
        ""

      • dependingValue

        public abstract java.lang.String dependingValue
        Specify value of parent field which enables this field. Used with dependsOnField(). You can use JavaScript notation for value comparison. Some valid Example: 
          
 @UiElement(fieldLoc = DOMAIN_SELECT_LOC, fieldType = Type.selectbox, order = 1)
 private String domain;
        
 @UiElement(fieldLoc = NAME_INPUT_LOC, fieldType = Type.selectbox, dependsOnField = "domain", dependingValue = "DUNS", order=3)
 public String name;
 
          
 This can also be written as:
 @UiElement(fieldLoc = NAME_INPUT_LOC, fieldType = Type.selectbox, dependsOnField = "domain", dependingValue = "${domain}=='DUNS'", order=3)
 public String name;
 
 @UiElement(fieldLoc = PASSWORD_INPUT_LOC, fieldType = Type.selectbox, dependsOnField = "domain", dependingValue = "${domain}!='DUNS' && ${domain}!='GLN'", order=3)
 public String password;

        Make sure that you have specified order() of parent filed less then child field.
        Returns:
        Default:
        ""

      • readonly

        public abstract boolean readonly
        specify whether this form field is read-only? Default is false.
        Returns:
        Default:
        false

      • required

        public abstract boolean required
        specify whether is this a required form field? Default is false. It is used when you want to fill just required form fields.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        BaseFormDataBean.fillUiRequiredElements()
        Default:
        false

      • order

        public abstract int order
        Specify the order in which form fields should be filled in UI. Default is Integer.MAX_VALUE
        Returns:
        Default:
        2147483647

      • pagewait

        public abstract boolean pagewait
        Deprecated. 
        Specify whether wait for page load required or not, after fill UI data. Default is false
        Returns:
        Default:
        false

      • elementClass

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends QAFExtendedWebElement> elementClass
        Optional, can be used to specify custom component to interact with UI. In case of custom component, it must have constructor with one argument as string to accept locator
        Returns:
        Since:
        2.1.9
        Default:
        com.qmetry.qaf.automation.ui.webdriver.QAFExtendedWebElement.class
